Detailed Description

UnlockAction shall analyze if the input string has the meaning of unlocking a lock. This class is only an "abstract" base class. All methods has to be implemented by the application developer, which shall define the various unlock string sequences.

Member Function Documentation

virtual InputAction* UnlockAction::Analyze (  const WString &  actionstring,
const InputContext *  context
)  [pure virtual]
 

overwrite this method, it has to analyze the actionstring, for the certain unlocking codes e.g. #9001key# and #9002key# etc. and set internal states like the unlock-type and the unlocking key in the derived class. Return 0 if there was a syntax error, return "this" if the analyzing was successfull. This method is called automatically by the InputAnalyzer.

Reimplemented from InputAction.

virtual BOOLEAN UnlockAction::Execute (   )  [pure virtual]
 

overwrite this method: this method shall execute dependend of the analyzed states (type of unlock, unlock key etc. set by the Analyze method) the unlock procedure by calling ADC methods.

Reimplemented from InputAction.

never overwrite this method

Reimplemented from InputAction.

virtual BOOLEAN UnlockAction::IsExecutionPossible (   )  [pure virtual]
 

overwrite: the internal state must be set after Analyze was called by the InputAnalyzer and method shall return TRUE if syntax analyzeing was successfull.

Reimplemented from InputAction.
